Class MvpViewStateFrameLayout<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrameLayout
      • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.layout.MvpFrameLayout<V,P>

  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public abstract class MvpViewStateFrameLayout<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
extends MvpFrameLayout<V,P>
implements MvpViewStateViewGroupDelegateCallback<V,P>
    A MvpFrameLayout with ViewState support.

    1.1

    • Method Detail

      • getMvpDelegate

        protected ViewGroupMvpDelegate<V,P> getMvpDelegate()
        Description copied from class: MvpFrameLayout
        Get the mvp delegate. This is internally used for creating presenter, attaching and detaching view from presenter etc.

        Please note that only one instance of mvp delegate should be used per android.view.View instance.

        Only override this method if you really know what you are doing.

        Overrides:
        getMvpDelegate in class MvpFrameLayout<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        ViewGroupMvpDelegateImpl

      • setRestoringViewState

        public void setRestoringViewState(boolean retstoringViewState)
        Description copied from interface: BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback
        This method will be called by MvpViewStateInternalDelegate to inform that restoring the view state is in progress.
        Specified by:
        setRestoringViewState in interface BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Parameters:
        retstoringViewState - true, if restoring viewstate is in progress, otherwise false

      • isRestoringViewState

        public boolean isRestoringViewState()
        Specified by:
        isRestoringViewState in interface BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        true if the viewstate is restoring right now (not finished yet). Otherwise false.

      • onViewStateInstanceRestored

        public void onViewStateInstanceRestored(boolean instanceStateRetained)
        Description copied from interface: BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback
        Called if the ViewState instance has been restored successfully.

        In this method you have to restore the viewstate by reading the view state properties and setup the view to be on the same state as before.

        Specified by:
        onViewStateInstanceRestored in interface BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Parameters:
        instanceStateRetained - true, if the viewstate has been retained by usingFragment#setRetainInstance(boolean), otherwise false (always false for activities).
